quizzes.title: History Quiz: China and Peoples Republic
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, title, opening. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What are the colors of the national flag of the Peoples Republic of China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red and golden

questions.question: The protagonist of the 1989 movie Born on the 4th of July is a veteran of what war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vietnam War

questions.question: Who was president of the Second Continental Congress and presumably the first person to sign the US Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Hancock

questions.question: Which one of the five elements are The legendary Chinese dragons believed to control?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water

questions.question: A horn from what animal is used as a modern replacement of  rhinoceros horn in traditional Chinese medicine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buffalo

questions.question: What is the largest city in the Peoples Republic of China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shanghai

questions.question: What kind of game is the traditional Chinese game of Go?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A board game

questions.question: What are the opening words of the US Declaration of Independence?

options.text: We mutually pledge to each other our Lives, our Fortunes, and our sacred Honor ...
Now is the time to lift our nation from the quicksand .....
When in the Course of human events it becomes necessary ....
We hold these truths to be self-evident .....

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When in the Course of human events it becomes necessary ....

questions.question: Which of the following was not a member of the Committee of Five that drafted Americas Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Hancock of Massachusetts

questions.question: Which of the following US Presidents died on July 4?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of the Peoples Republic of China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March of the Volunteers

questions.question: What policy was adopted by the Chinese government to curb population growth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One-child policy

questions.question: What is the longest river in China as well as all of Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yangtze River

questions.question: What is the official religion of China, as adopted as by the government?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atheism

questions.question: Who was King of Great Britain when the American Revolutionary War broke out in 1775?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George III

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Cuba and Independence
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, title, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the most important mineral resource in Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nickel

questions.question: What is the official language of the Republic of Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish

questions.question: Why did George Washington not sign the US Declaration of Independence?

options.text: He favored reconciliation with Great Britain.
He was commanding the Continental Army at that time.
He had retired to Mount Vermont.
He didnt approve of the wording of the Declaration.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was commanding the Continental Army at that time.

questions.question: The Syng inkstand was used during the signing of the US Declaration of Independence and what other historical document?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The US Constitution (1787)

questions.question: What is the name of the second-largest Cuban island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isle of Youth

questions.question: What is the name of the capital and largest city of the Republic of Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Havana

questions.question: What was the first American colony to renounce allegiance to the King of Great Britain in 1776?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: What is the official name of the Statue of Liberty, which commemorates the centennial of the signing of the US Declaration of Independence?

options.text: Lady Liberty Entering the New World

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liberty Enlightening the World

questions.question: What religion is adopted as official by the government of the Republic of Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of the Republic of Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bayamo Anthem

questions.question: In this movie, the engrossed copy of the US Declaration of Independence is stolen because it is believed to contain clues to a hidden treasure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Treasure

questions.question: Which of these colors is not present on the national flag of Cuba, officially adopted in 1902?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: What is one of the possible translations of the name Cuba which comes from the Taino language?

options.text: Where the sea makes love to the coast

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Where fertile land is abundant

questions.question: Which of the following events did not occur in July 1776?

options.text: The British evacuate Boston threatened by cannons on Dorchester Heights.
The Liberty Bell rings for the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence
The Continental Congress passes the Lee Resolution.
An angry mob topples the equestrian statue of George III in New York City.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The British evacuate Boston threatened by cannons on Dorchester Heights.

questions.question: Which of these Founding Fathers was not one of the three US representatives who signed the Treaty of Paris in 1783?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Island and Rutgers University
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bali is known as the Island of the Thousand Temples.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the meaning of the phrase Ropa vieja, which denotes a traditional dish very popular in Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old clothes

questions.question: Which of the following is located on the Italian island Capri?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following well-known people did not attend Rutgers University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julia Roberts

questions.question: Who were the first European colonizers on Saint Lucia, one of the Caribbean Islands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the French

questions.question: Rutgers University was originally founded under this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queens College

questions.question: Rutgers University was founded in 1766.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the smallest Asian nation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Maldives

questions.question: Pamalican Island is part of the Philippines.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Greek island Santorini took its present form after a huge volcanic eruption in 1650 BC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The highest sea cliffs in the world can be seen on this island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Molokai, Hawaii

questions.question: Which of the following islands is part of French Polynesia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Lizard Island is Australias northernmost island resort.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The 1920 silent film Terror Island, starring Harry Houdini and directed by James Cruze, was filmed on Catalina Island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these music genres originated in Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Hawaii and Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, stadium, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was he island of Hawaii named after?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its discoverer

questions.question: Rutgers Stadium is located in New Brunswick.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following campuses at Rutgers New Brunswick is not an actual college?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Busch

questions.question: What plant was widely grown in the plantations on the island of Hawaii by 1996, supporting its economy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sugarcane

questions.question: What kind of sand is common for the beaches of the Hawaii island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black sand

questions.question: What type of food is the Filipino meal Halo-halo, also very popular on the island of Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dessert

questions.question: The dining hall on Douglass campus is named after which of the following donors to Rutgers University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Neilson

questions.question: Which of these volcanoes is not located on the island of Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Menengai

questions.question: The Rutgers New Brunswick campus is so large that it has its own bus system.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the meaning of the phrase Nani Mau, the name of the beautiful and enormous botanical gardens on the island of Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forever beautiful

questions.question: Rutgers University is known for its fat sandwiches.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What common name is used to refer to the island of Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Big Island

questions.question: What town is the largest settlement on the island of Hawaii and the the second largest settlement in the state of Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hilo

questions.question: What is the name of the popular coffee that is cultivated on the island of Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kona coffee

questions.question: The juice of what fruit is used in the preparation of the very popular cocktail Blue Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pineapple

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Philippines and Province
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, reptile, egypt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This disputed territory is a Malaysian state, located on the island of Borneo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sabah

questions.question: Palawan is the largest province of the Philippines.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the national animal of Egypt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eagle

questions.question: What large mammal is one of the national symbols of the Peoples Republic of China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giant Panda

questions.question: This extinct volcanic ridge is in the western Philippine Sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benham Rise

questions.question: What large feline is the national animal of Romania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynx

questions.question: This disputed area is a group of islands and reefs, located between the Macclesfield Bank and Luzon, Philippines in the South China Sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scarborough Shoal

questions.question: The Banaue Rice Terraces are located in what landlocked province of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ifugao

questions.question: What kind of reptile is a national symbol of Cuba?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crocodile

questions.question: This landlocked province of the Philippines borders Ilocos Norte, Ilocos Sur, Apayao, Kalinga and Moutain Province. Its capital is Bangued.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abra

questions.question: This province of the Philippines borders Nueva Ecija, Quirino, Isabela, Quezon, Bulacan and Nueva Ecija.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aurora

questions.question: What domestic animal is the national symbol of the Isle of Man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cat

questions.question: In 1942, this province of the Philippines, which used to be a territory of the vast Cagayan Valley, was occupied by Japanese troops.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nueva Vizcaya

questions.question: This landlocked province, located in the Central Luzon region, is often referred to as the “Rice Granary of the Philippines”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nueva Ecija

questions.question: What dog breed is one of the symbols of Mexico, and is named after a Mexican state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chihuahua

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Oregon and State
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, nickname, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Oscar-winning movie was set and filmed in the U.S. state of Oregon.

options.text: One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest

questions.question: What is the official state beverage of the U.S. state of Oregon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milk

questions.question: The character portrayed by this actress wins the title Miss Mississippi in the 1952 movie Were Not Married.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe

questions.question: What is the name of the capital and largest city of the US state of Mississippi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackson

questions.question: What incident, involving US President Theodore Roosevelt, happened in Sharkey County, Mississippi in 1902, ?

options.text: He ate a whole raw chicken to win a a bet, and got sick.
He spared the life of a bear.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He spared the life of a bear.

questions.question: Which of these animals is a national symbol of the Bahamas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What river makes up a large part of the northern border of the U.S. state of Oregon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbia River

questions.question: Which of these celebrities was born in the US state of Mississippi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oprah Winfrey

questions.question: Which of these is a nickname of the U.S. state of Oregon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beaver State

questions.question: What is the official state fruit of the U.S. state of Oregon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pear

questions.question: What bird, endemic to Africa, is depicted on the coats of arms of Sudan and the Republic of South Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Secretary Bird

questions.question: What is the name of the capital city of the U.S. state of Oregon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salem

questions.question: What lemur species endemic to Madagascar is the national symbol of the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ring-tailed Lemur

questions.question: The common elk, also called an European moose, is a national symbol of this European country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norway

questions.question: In what sport does the Portland Trail Blazers team from Oregon, USA, compete?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basketball
